intro: Lepyrodia macra, commonly known as the tall lepidothamnus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Lepyrodia macra is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
